action.action-desc: Ms. Jackson Lee (for herself and Mr. Conyers) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide an alternate release date for certain nonviolent offenders, to amend title 18, United States Code, with respect to the computation of the good time credit toward service of sentences of imprisonment, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Prison Bureau Relief Act of 2015.

section.header: Early release for certain nonviolent offenders

subsection.text: Section 3624 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by inserting at the early release date provided in subsection (g), if applicable, or otherwise after A prisoner shall be released by the Bureau of Prisons; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Early release for certain nonviolent offenders
subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Bureau of Prisons, pursuant to a good time policy, shall release from confinement a prisoner who has served one-half or more of his term of imprisonment (including any consecutive term or terms of imprisonment) if that prisoner—

paragraph.text: has attained the age of 45 years;
has never been convicted of a crime of violence; and
has not engaged in any violation, involving violent conduct, of institutional disciplinary regulations.

subsection.text: Section 3624(b)(1) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking , beyond the time served, of up to 54 days at the end of each year of the prisoner’s term of imprisonment, beginning at the end of the first year of the term, and inserting of up to 54 days for each year of the prisoner’s sentence imposed by the court,.

Section 3624(b)(1) is amended by striking the sentence beginning Credit that has not been earned and inserting The Bureau may subsequently restore any or all credit previously denied, based on the prisoner’s maintaining good behavior as determined by the Bureau..

The amendments made by this section apply with respect to each prison sentence that has not been completed before the date of the enactment of this Act, except any sentence imposed before November 1, 1987.
